name: Memphis BBQ Pork Totchos
author: Leslie Kelly
summary: A mashup of the BBQ pork nachos that are on so many menus in Memphis and the South-of-the-Border influenced Totchos that have blown up as the must-try bar food in Seattle. Serve with extra barbeque sauce for dipping.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Extra Crispy Tater Tots®)
¼ cup chopped pickled jalapeno peppers
½ cup barbeque sauce (such as Cattlemen's®)
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Arrange potato nuggets in a single layer on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes
Shake baking sheet and continue baking until potato nuggets are extra crispy, 20 to 24 minutes longer
Remove baking sheet from oven and turn on oven's broiler
Top potato nuggets with pepperjack cheese, pulled pork, onion, and jalapeno peppers
Broil in the preheated oven until cheese starts to bubble, 5 to 7 minutes
Top "totchos" with coleslaw and green onions
